intro: Palicourea rigida f. longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled palicourea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. The inflorescence consists of clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. The plant produces small, elliptical berries that contain the seeds. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments.
